docs.title: Agent Weaver Architecture Overview
docs.content:
# Agent Weaver Architecture

Agent Weaver implements a multi-agent system where 5 specialized AI agents (Product Manager, Architect, Developer, QA, Code Reviewer) collaborate through a shared context board.

## Core Components

### 1. Context Board (.weaver/context.json)
The persistent memory store that all agents read from and write to. Eliminates agent amnesia and duplicate work.

### 2. MCP Server (55 Tools)
Provides 19 modules across:
- **Indexing**: Tree-sitter AST parsing, code maps generation
- **Planning**: Multi-agent planning, approval gates
- **Context**: Shared memory read/write
- **Team**: Git-based sharing, hub sync
- **Hub**: Central team repository

### 3. Next.js Dashboard
Real-time visualization of agent activity with:
- Context board view
- Code intelligence (class/module maps)
- Plan navigator
- Team collaboration view
- Live SSE updates

## Data Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  A[Gemini CLI] --> B[MCP Server]
  B --> C[Context Board]
  B --> D[Code Index]
  C --> E[Dashboard]
  D --> E
  F[Hub Server] --> C
  G[Team Members] --> F
```

docs.title: MCP Tool Reference
docs.content:
# MCP Tools Reference

## Indexing Tools (5 tools)

### read_project
Scans the codebase and detects project structure, tech stack, and dependencies.

**Usage:**
```typescript
await mcp.call('read_project', { path: '/path/to/project' })
```

### enrich_symbols
Uses LLM to add semantic descriptions to code symbols.

### search_code
Semantic search across indexed code using AI embeddings.

## Planning Tools (8 tools)

### generate_plan
Creates a structured implementation plan with change groups and file maps.

### approve_plan
Human-in-the-loop approval gate for plans.

### write_diagram
Generates Mermaid diagrams for architecture visualization.

## Context Tools (6 tools)

### write_context_entry
Writes to the shared context board.

### read_context
Reads the current context board state.

### filter_context
Queries context entries by agent, phase, or type.

## Team Tools (4 tools)

### sync_to_hub
Pushes local annotations to the central hub.

### pull_from_hub
Downloads team annotations from the hub.

### verify_annotation
Marks an AI-generated annotation as human-verified.

docs.title: Getting Started Guide
docs.content:
# Getting Started with Agent Weaver

## Installation

1. **Clone and build the MCP server:**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/agent-weaver.git
cd agent-weaver
npm install
npm run build
```

2. **Configure Gemini CLI:**
Add to your Gemini config:
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "agent-weaver": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["/path/to/agent-weaver/dist/index.js"]
    }
  }
}
```

3. **Start the dashboard:**
```bash
cd dashboard
export WEAVER_PROJECT_PATH=/path/to/your/project
npm install
npm run dev
```

## First Steps

### 1. Index Your Project
```
User: @agent-weaver read and index this codebase
```

The agents will scan your project and build a code map.

### 2. Create a Plan
```
User: @agent-weaver create a plan to add user authentication
```

The Product Manager and Architect will collaborate to generate a detailed plan.

### 3. Review in Dashboard
Open http://localhost:3000 to see:
- Agent discussions
- Generated plan
- Code intelligence maps
- Architecture diagrams

docs.title: Team Collaboration Workflow
docs.content:
# Team Collaboration with Hub Sync

## Overview

Agent Weaver enables git-based team sharing. When one teammate indexes a codebase, all team members benefit from the shared annotations.

## Setup Hub Server

1. **Start the hub:**
```bash
cd hub
npm install
npm start
```

Hub runs on http://localhost:4200

2. **Configure team members:**
Each developer sets their WEAVER_HUB_URL:
```bash
export WEAVER_HUB_URL=http://your-hub.com
```

## Sync Workflow

### Push Annotations
```
User: @agent-weaver sync my annotations to the team
```

This uploads your verified annotations to the hub.

### Pull Team Annotations
```
User: @agent-weaver pull latest team annotations
```

Downloads annotations from teammates.

## Verification Process

1. **AI generates annotations** (confidence score)
2. **Human verifies** (marks as verified)
3. **Verified annotations sync** to team
4. **Trust builds over time** (accuracy tracking)

## Benefits

- **No redundant indexing**: One scan benefits the whole team
- **Shared knowledge**: Team annotations improve over time
- **Human-verified**: Trust through verification
- **Git-based**: Works with your existing workflow
